The door is inserted into the deeper groove at an angle and laterally displaced until the other edge is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove.
* The door includes a lock assembly on the reverse side with a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement, and reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
* The invention is applicable to a floor safe formed using a liner and concrete, or a steel fabrication method, and includes variations such as a modified liner with a lower portion defining a peripheral door receiving ledge and laterally opposing grooves for receiving the door's plate member, with structural integrity provided by concrete and rebars.

* The invention describes a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, focusing on isolating the pressure sensor to measure pressures at a desired depth without interference from pressures above and below the sensor. This is achieved through a staged cementing and fluid injection process that clears the sensor of cement grout and establishes a fluid connection to the formation.
* The method involves installing a conduit with a filter at the bottom end in a borehole at a desired location, pressurizing the conduit to clear the filter of cement grout, and then introducing a fluid to displace the cement grout and establish a connection between the filter and the formation. In some embodiments, a hydrofracture process is used to further ensure connectivity. The pressure sensor is then installed in the conduit, isolated to the formation pressures at the filter depth.

• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails, and road bed plate joints in road bridges, footbridges, etc.

• The structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.

• The elastic members are of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, mainly consisting of laminated rubber. The joint block is made of the same concrete as the traveling path for increased slip resistance.

• The elastic members and joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like, allowing easy maintenance. Supporting blocks can be mounted inside the steps to protect the traveling path ends.

• The invention prevents tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensures smooth and safe vehicle traveling, and facilitates maintenance. It is adaptable for various tire configurations, ensuring high slip resistance and easy maintenance.

• The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to move wheeled trucks without contaminating the chamber's sanitary environment.

• The system includes a wheel channel above the fluid level, supported by legs, with one sidewall extending higher than the other.

• The higher sidewall has a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel, accommodating the truck's axle structure.

• The cover plate can be hinged to the longer sidewall for easy cleaning of the channel.

• Another embodiment utilizes inflatable elastomer seals attached along the length of the sidewall top edges to enclose the wheel channel.

• The seals are hose-like and inflate to form a seal around the hand truck wheel struts, preventing entry of the brine solution.

• The seals also act as a brake when inflated, stopping the movement of meat-laden hand trucks along the track.

• The system is adaptable for use with various transport vehicles, not limited to hand trucks.

• The enclosed floor track system prevents brine solution from entering the wheel channel area, maintaining the solution's sanitary nature.

• The recovery and reuse of the brine solution preserve natural resources and achieve economic advantages.

• The invention fulfills the need for an enclosed floor track system that prevents contamination of the brine solution and supports the efficient processing of meat products.

* The invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine of a construction machine from tilting due to its weight, specifically designed to prevent a backhoe work machine's boom from rotating downward.
* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that can be manually operated to lock or unlock the boom. The engaging member features a slot and a guide member to maintain its position, allowing for easy lock and unlock operations.
* The guide member is positioned to maintain the lock position of the engaging member at any rotation of the boom between its highest and lowest positions, simplifying the device and reducing costs.
* The lock plate can be provided either on the boom or the boom bracket, with the latter construction eliminating the need for a separate guide member, further reducing part numbers and assembly processes.

• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform, where the central, vacuum portion is adjustable relative to the pool bottom for precise suction regulation during cleaning.

• The adjustable suction head includes conveniently located adjustment mechanisms on its top, enabling real-time suction regulation without adjusting the pump.

• The apparatus overcomes drawbacks of prior devices by providing an adjustment on the vacuum head itself, allowing quick and easy regulation of suction without needing hand tools or adjustments at the circulation pump.

• The adjustment mechanisms precisely regulate the spacing between the suction head's lower surface and the pool bottom, improving suction efficiency.

• The invention includes a kit form roller height adjustment device that can be easily assembled to certain existing suction head assemblies with minimal modification, facilitating precise suction regulation.

* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools.
* Wear bushings protect against excessive wear in oil and gas well drilling operations.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit for mounting onto the drill string.
* The sub-unit has a mandrel with a longitudinal bore and two collars.
* The retriever section is substantially circular, with a bore for fitting around the mandrel.
* It features protruding members for engaging with the J-slot of the wear bushing.
* The retriever section can slide along the mandrel but is prevented from rotating.
* The sub-unit allows the retriever to move vertically without rotating.
* The retriever can be easily mounted onto the mandrel and connected to drill pipe.
* The apparatus enables quick removal of the wear bushing during drilling operations.
* An additional embodiment uses threading for retrieving a specific type of wear bushing.

* The invention pertains to downhole vibratory tools that selectively allow passage for other tools.
* Vibratory tools are used to dislodge stuck objects, known as "fish," from downhole locations.
* They also facilitate the transmission of forces to fish stuck in deviated wellbores.
* Traditional vibratory tools operate on a principle of applying overpull to stretch a string while compressing a spring.
* Pressure builds up, causing a valve to open, which then closes as the spring force increases.
* This cycle repeats, creating a sudden drop in pressure that causes the piston to snap back, re-closing the valve.
* Common limitations of earlier designs include the inability to run a wireline through the tool body and the presence of a central valve that limits wireline access.
* More recent designs, like the one in U.S. Pat. No. 6,866,104, allow wireline access but introduce compromises due to the design of a dart assembly.
* The new tool design reconfigures the dump valve into an annular shape, providing a clear central passage for wireline operations.
* It uses modular stacked piston units to deliver additional power per stroke, enhancing the tool's performance.
* The tool can be configured to deliver high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces to fish without impacts, depending on operational settings.
* Key features include a clear central passage, an annular dump valve, modular piston design, and the capability to operate with or without impacts.
* The tool is versatile, suitable for fish release, stimulation, and fishing operations, and relies on a single valve for operation.
* It also includes a rotational lock for torque transmission between the mandrel and housing.

* The invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system for highways and railways, designed to overcome limitations of conventional retaining walls in terms of height and stability.
* The system comprises a precast, solid base and a face panel with an integral counterfort, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases compared to traditional designs. This modular approach reduces installation costs and eliminates the need for temporary shoring.
* The counterforts provide additional support, enabling the wall to withstand overturning moments without requiring extensive excavation behind the wall. This design allows for taller walls with reduced impact on the surrounding soil.
* The retaining wall can be customized in terms of height and width, offering flexibility in design and application. The use of precast components ensures efficient and cost-effective construction.
* Additional features, such as vehicle impact barriers, can be integrated into the wall system, enhancing safety and functionality. The modular design supports the addition of these features without compromising structural integrity.

* The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well to improve production.
* The invention addresses two primary shortcomings in conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements protecting electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The system includes a down hole heating unit designed to overcome unrecognized problems leading to frequent failure of prior art heating units, and focuses and contains heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing.
* The heating unit is designed to be impenetrably shielded from pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore to prevent electrical problems and shorting of electrical circuits caused by invasion of heater units by conductive fluids.
* The system utilizes solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation for reliable power delivery to the heating rods, and includes a method for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow, which can also be utilized by substituting cable for down hole pipe during well treatments or maintenance.
* The invention is not limited to the described embodiments and various modifications and alternative embodiments will become apparent to persons skilled in the art upon the reference to the description of the invention.

• The invention relates to a simply and efficiently operable mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including those that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. It aims to provide a tool that can effectively connect to a down hole object or 'fish' and allows for simple and effective disconnection if desired.

• The mechanism can take the form of an external pull tool or an internal pull tool, depending on the specific service operation involved. It consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure disposed in a movable relation within it. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures allows the tool to move into a gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.

• The tool is secured about the inner body by a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, depending on the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures. A pin structure forms part of the catch mechanism, which alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.

• The tool can be locked or unlocked with respect to the down hole object simply by downward or upward movement of the control line tool. This allows for easy disconnection upon simple mechanical movement of the wire line controlled pulling tool, making it suitable for various down hole service operations such as installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.

• The document claims priority to previous patent applications and relates to the improvement of stave floors, particularly modular composed stave floors.

• Conventional composed stave floors have a sight substrate with a thickness of 2-3 mm, which is prone to deformation and detachment upon sanding or rushing.

• The drawbacks of conventional floors include thin sight substrates, "de-rolling" of wood, and the use of glue for assembly, which can lead to deformations, changes in dimensions, and long curing times.

• The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, provide a substrate without deformation trends, and bond both sheets without displacement or change of dimensions.

• It introduces a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate of at least 4 mm thickness and a base substrate of at least 12 mm thickness, assembled with glue and multidirectional holding means.

• The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.

• The example embodiment provides a major life span for the floors and allows for corrective maintenance.

• It also aims to provide improved composed stave floors with pre-applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the need for on-site glaze application.

• The document includes detailed descriptions, figures, and examples comparing conventional stave floors with those of the example embodiment.

• The example embodiments are not limited to the described objects and include variations that would be obvious to one skilled in the art.

• The invention relates to ladder attachments that improve lateral stability, prevent damage to work surfaces, and prevent ladder slipping or sliding.

• A brace for a ladder includes an extension arm with a flange and an opening, a U-bolt inserted through the flange's openings, and a resilient pad assembly pivotally connected to the extension arm.

• The brace assembly is attached to the ladder's siderails, providing a non-slip gripping portion that increases the contact area with the work surface without damaging it.

• The ladder can straddle corners without losing stability, thanks to the brace assembly's ability to pivot and contact opposite faces of a corner.

• The brace assembly is installed by attaching the resilient pad assembly to the arm, aligning the arm with the rung, inserting the U-bolt, positioning the clamp, and securing it with a bolt.

• The invention improves ladder stability, prevents work surface damage, and allows for corner straddling, making it a versatile solution for various working conditions.

* The invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The nails are assembled in a staggered or stepped manner, with the major axis of the nail forming an angle to the longitudinal direction of the strip.
* The plastic material used is an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy, or a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene.
* The plastic is molded onto the nails and adhered to the nail shanks, reducing debris generation when the nail is driven into the substrate.
* The plastic collation system can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another, reducing debris by reducing the impact on the connecting portion by the fastener as it is driven into the substrate.
* The plastic collation can be coiled for use in driving tools that accept collations in this manner, and can be configured with various features to minimize debris generation and enhance nail penetration.

* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly useful in diverse industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* It comprises a bell or hood lower section coupled to an injection button with a specific design, facilitating the application of silicone and similar sealants.
* The button has channels and orifices for precise sealing operations, especially for encapsulating rivets or screws in the aeronautical industry.
* The nozzle allows for both manual and automated sealant injection processes, improving encapsulation and sealing of rivets and nuts.
* It is designed to be used with cartridges or injection machines, offering versatility in its application.
* The button's design substantially improves the sealing of rivets and nuts, allowing for application both manually and by automated machines.
* The bell-shaped tip is suitable for use in the aviation industry and other related sectors.
* The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, for durability and ease of use.
* The button is coupled to the bell-shaped section in a strong but non-permanent manner, allowing for easy fitting or removal.
* The nozzle simplifies sealing work, reducing application time, and saving labor, leading to a more economical and high-quality sealing process.

• The invention is directed to a position sensor that includes a waveform generator for receiving an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifying the signal in response to an error correction signal, and an error correction generator for providing the error correction signal.

• The error correction generator comprises a comparator for determining the value of the conditioned sensing signal, a controller for providing first and second timing signals based on the value, and a signal processor for generating the error correction signal based on the timing signals.

• The sensor is designed for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires, using two wires to provide power and receive the conditioned sensing signal.

• The window reference circuit constantly compares the ideal sensor output to the existing output, adjusting it if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.

• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed, optimizing energy usage.

• The sensor is recalibratable at any time by external means, and upon startup, it draws a minimum of current, facilitating initial calibration and efficient operation.

• The document claims priority to a provisional application for a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.

• The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in four-stroke piston engines, aiming to improve valve control and efficiency.

• The current method of controlling valves uses a timing belt connecting the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, with cams opening and closing valves through springs that provide the force to close the valves.

• The invention proposes a kinematic system that eliminates the need for springs, allowing for more precise control of valve opening and closing, and potentially higher engine speeds.

• The system includes a reciprocating cam translating device that interacts with a second controllable actuating means, which can vary the percentage of valve port opening.

• The invention allows for the control of any number of pistons and valve opening percentages, optimizing engine performance and fuel economy.

• The system can be computer-controlled, adjusting the valve operation based on vehicle performance, ensuring smooth engine operation.

• The invention offers a simplified, robust construction for a valve actuator that is precise and controlled, enhancing engine performance and efficiency.

* The document is a continuation application of previous patents and provisional applications, focusing on aquarium lighting using LEDs.
* The light member includes a housing with a top side facing away from the aquarium and a bottom side facing the aquarium's interior. It features a lighting control region on the bottom side with first and second control channels for white and blue light, respectively, and a neutral channel.
* The light member also includes switches coupled to the housing, allowing control of the first control channel.
* A light-emitting module is sized to be coupled to the lighting control region, having an LED that emits a specific color of light and electrical connectors that couple to the control channels.
* The light member can have two lighting control regions, each with its own set of control channels, allowing for more complex lighting control.
* The light member can be controlled remotely through an RF module, which receives power from the control channels but is controlled by an RF signal from a remote control.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, addressing the limitations of traditional designs.
* Known flow deflection apparatuses, like stator or rotor blades in gas turbines, face high ambient temperatures exceeding material limits, necessitating internal cooling channels.
* Current cooling channels and separating walls are cast, leading to issues like material concentration, thermal stresses, increased weight, and complex casting processes.
* The objective is to provide a simpler, more efficient, and flexible flow deflection apparatus that avoids these drawbacks.
* The invention achieves this by constructing separating walls as separate inserts, inserted into the apparatus post-casting, ensuring better cooling, reduced weight, and simplified production.
* Inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials, offering flexibility in design and material selection.
* A preferred embodiment features hollow castings with integral holders for the inserts, ensuring secure seating and efficient cooling.
* Security is enhanced by connecting the inserts to the apparatus through an integral material joint, typically via soldering or welding.
* The apparatus is particularly advantageous for gas turbine blades, offering simplification in complex geometries.
* For high-speed rotor blades, the cooling channels and separating walls extend radially, with the integral material joint positioned at the separating walls' end near the axis for optimal strength.

* The invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, enabling automatic or manual control. It aims to provide smooth switching between control modes without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position. It processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor for automatic throttle control or outputs a signal to a clutch for manual control. The control unit ensures a seamless transition between automatic and manual control by aligning the throttle valve position with the accelerator pedal position.
* The system is designed to improve upon existing fuel delivery control systems by offering automatic control for optimal performance and manual control for full operation when automatic control fails or is not desired. It can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, adjusting control modes based on transmission ratios.

• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels like wood waste, aiming to provide clean combustion and minimal particulate emissions.

• It addresses the inefficiency of conventional wood waste fuel burners, which discharge high amounts of gaseous and particulate pollution, affecting boiler performance and requiring frequent, expensive cleaning.

• The primary objective is to develop a waste fuel burner that emits discharges of very minimal quantities of particulate materials within the levels permitted by local environmental regulations.

• Another objective is to provide a waste wood fuel burner that operates producing little slag or clinkers, effectively burning wet wood of 70% moisture content.

• The invention aims to provide a waste fuel burner that is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load, comparable to conventional gas and oil burners.

• It seeks to provide a waste fuel burner that burns wood of nominal ash content and produces a residue that is free of clinkers, assuming the ash fusing temperature is not lower than 1700°F.

• The method and apparatus form a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile in controlled amounts, drying and gasifying the waste fuel in the pile.

• Volatile gases driven off the pile by heat generated by the oxidation of the fixed carbon on the surface of the pile are then partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially with a very vigorous swirl in a first or primary combustion chamber.

• The total amount of combustion air admitted to the primary chamber is maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions so that the temperature in the primary combustion chamber remains lower than the necessary to melt the natural ash, dirt, or other inorganic substances in the fuel.

• The swirl air also forces particulate out of the gas stream leaving the primary chamber, and the volatile gases move around the disc-shaped flame holder into a second combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced to an amount above stoichiometric proportions for complete combustion.

• The secondary air introduced in the secondary combustion chamber is directed tangentially, and the combustion air introduced to the primary and secondary chambers is introduced on the outside of a refractory lining to cool the lining and increase its life.

* The invention provides an efficient apparatus for cooling air, utilizing a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides to evaporate water without increasing the moisture content of the useful air. The major portion of the working air is drawn from the load, and the useful air passes through the dry side of the heat exchanger in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members.
* The system includes specific constructional details for maximum efficiency, such as the use of an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members for the wet side, with water flowing downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of return air from the load. The dry side utilizes fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling, with the cooled fresh air being delivered to the enclosure.

* The document describes a fluid pump comprising two or more pump heads configured in series for pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
* Each pump head contains an impeller moving fluid through at least two conduits, which are combined into a single flow before exiting the pump head.
* The pump heads are connected through a drive structure, such as a drive shaft or connector, allowing common driving of the impellers.
* The pump can be powered by a single motor, with the drive structure transmitting motion to all impellers.
* The pump heads are designed to be modular, allowing for easy repair and scalability by adding more pump heads.
* The pump can be mounted on various support structures like wheeled booms, hitching assemblies, or trailers for easy transport and operation.
* The pump is suitable for pumping high volumes of fluids, particularly liquid manure from animal husbandry operations, with features to accommodate solid material without plugging.

• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for engines with fewer than all cylinders.

• Traditional systems include an engine brake for each cylinder, which can lead to excess components.

• The present invention aims to provide a reduced number of components for engine braking.

• An engine includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, with brakes attached to a portion of these cylinders.

• A method is provided for engine braking using less than all engine cylinders by attaching brakes to a portion of the cylinders.

• Each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.

• The engine includes a low pressure reservoir, high pressure pump, and electronic control module for managing engine operation.

• Engine cylinders have movable pistons that undergo intake, compression, power, and exhaust strokes.

• Engine compression release brakes can be activated during the compression stroke to facilitate engine braking.

• The invention allows for modular engine compression release brakes, offering flexibility in braking horsepower for specific applications.

• The text discusses a mounting link assembly between an engine and a gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads from blade-off events and other shocks.

• The assembly includes a male link coupled to the engine or gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or gearbox, and a pin that selectively retains the male and female links.

• The female link receives the male link, allowing translation of the male link relative to the female link and forming a radial interface that dampens this translation.

• The pin, designed to shear under high loads, releases the male and female links, allowing the gearbox to move relative to the engine.

• The radial interface between the female and male links provides coulomb damping, dissipating energy created by their relative motion.

• Snap rings can be used to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link, preventing separation after the pin is sheared.

• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.

• The assembly allows for maintenance, as the pin can be replaced after a shock event, enabling repair or replacement of damaged engine components.

• The technical function of the embodiments described is to provide a mounting link assembly that can withstand extreme loads while allowing for relative movement between the engine and the gearbox.

• The text concludes by stating that the use of the pin and coulomb damping in the mounting link assembly obviates the need for all components to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.

* The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically to an end adaptor apparatus and balance pin apparatus designed to attach arrow points and nocks to shafts and balance the shafts. It addresses the shortcomings of prior art, such as stress on the shaft's wall due to internal threads and the risk of dirt entering the shaft when arrow points are removed.
* The present invention introduces a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted in weight for perfect balance. It includes a point cap and a balance pin, which can vary in size to adjust weight. The system reduces material and weight, making it suitable for light and slim graphite arrows. The balance pin allows for precise point weight adjustment, ensuring the arrow is perfectly balanced.
* The invention also features a means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt entry when the arrow points are not attached. It utilizes an external thread system on the point cap, reducing stress on the shaft's end. The point cap is made from hardened steel, and the balance pin is adjustable for weight, enhancing the arrow's performance and balance.

• The invention is a cost-effective small arms training device that simulates the sound and flash of gunfire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.

• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.

• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.

• The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced through the weapon's ejection port.

• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfacing with the weapon trigger and bolt.

• The device aims to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, inexpensive means for realistic training, a reliable, low maintenance, reusable training device, and a pyrotechnic simulation without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber.

• The invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that aims to enhance engine performance by optimally utilizing dynamic effects and reducing intake noise.

• The device comprises a tank defining a volume, two pipes connecting the tank to the intake passage with different cross-sectional areas, and a valve in one of the pipes controlled by an actuator based on engine operating conditions.

• The larger pipe has a cross-sectional area equal to or larger than that of the intake passage, while the smaller pipe, located closer to the air cleaner, has a cross-sectional area smaller than one-tenth of the larger pipe's area. This design allows for a reduction in noise while improving engine performance.

• The control valve's operation is optimized based on engine speed and load conditions, with the valve being closed when the load is below a certain threshold and opened when the load exceeds this threshold, enhancing engine performance within the accessible operating range.

• The invention is a two-part bracket designed for simple mounting of speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. It consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that allows for easy aiming and installation by one person.

• The bracket assembly includes components that are resistant to weather, wind, and vibration, making it suitable for outdoor use. It is designed to be lightweight and robust, providing economic and time efficiency for the installer. The system uses a minimal amount of inexpensive components to achieve a secure and adjustable mounting solution for various objects such as loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras.

* The present disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner designed for use with a variety of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances.
* The burner features an efficient design that optimizes combustion, reduces unburned fuel emissions, and includes components for secondary and tertiary combustion to enhance heat utilization.
* It incorporates a shroud surrounding the outer wall to guide air flow and establish a flow path for tertiary combustion, while also providing an external surface that remains cool to prevent burns.
* The burner has legs to elevate it above ground level, a pivotally coupled ash pan for easy ash removal, and a perforate food grate and cover to prevent accidental ingress and exposure to heat and exhaust fumes.
* The system allows for the attachment of various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer, through manual couplings.

* The invention aims to improve the efficiency of combustion and cooling in rotary internal combustion engines, particularly focusing on the housing water cooling system.
* The housing water cooling system is crucial for reducing the temperature of the metal areas exposed to high heat input and minimizing temperature differences to prevent destruction.
* The most severe cooling problem is in the combustion chamber area, especially around spark plugs, due to uneven heating causing housing distortion and potential failure of gas and oil sealing elements.
* The time for cooling by fresh inducted air is short, leading to high wall temperatures sensitive to load changes, with the combustion surface temperature being much higher than the housing side walls.
* Sudden engine acceleration, especially in winter or high-speed driving, exposes the rotor housing and associated trochoid wall to thermal loads, leading to thermal fatigue or thermal shock cracks.
* The use of in-line or dual spark plugs for a single rotor housing is common, aiming to improve combustion efficiency and ensure complete air-fuel mixture combustion.
* However, this arrangement disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, collects vapor films, and prevents effective heat extraction, especially in the vertically upward flow direction.
* The invention proposes a new ignition and cooling system combination to maintain efficient combustion while improving cooling characteristics to reduce structural failure risks.
* It involves using staggered spark plug bosses in the cooling flow passageway, offset but symmetrically oppositely oriented about a centerplane, to promote close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals.
* The staggered arrangement allows for a controlled flow regime, reduces vapor binding films, and increases the heat transfer coefficient by at least 20% compared to prior art capabilities.
* The preferred embodiment includes cylindrically shaped spark plug bosses cast into the engine water jacket passageway, with a specific offset from the centerplane to prevent detrimental effects on combustion flame propagation while allowing staggered boss configuration.
* Tests on a water model passageway simulating the passage of spark plug bosses showed a 44% increase in heat transfer coefficient for the staggered configuration compared to the in-line arrangement, indicating improved cooling efficiency.

• The present invention relates to minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, specifically by using control valve positions as feedback to minimize such disturbance.

• The method involves maintaining the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which helps in keeping the steam generator pressure constant and unaffected during inlet control valve testing. This minimizes turbine power changes during the testing process.

• The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, i.e., valve stem lift. The difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine flow control valves is known for any given valve not under test, which is used to calculate the additional flow demand required for the valves when one valve is closed for testing.

• The invention uses a test compensation circuit that converts the total flow demand into the required valve position and generates an output that establishes Valve Position Demand. This output is received by a valve servo position loop which provides closed-loop position control of the lift of the valve.

• The effectiveness of the method is demonstrated through a mathematical model of a turbine system, where the use of the control valve test compensating control significantly reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure during valve testing.

• The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.

• The valve allows for a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid to be produced.

• The system is designed for pressurized cleaning apparatuses, including garden hoses, car washes, drain cleaning, and commercial aircraft cleaning.

• A spool valve is used to direct the two fluids towards the outlet, adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid and 100% second fluid.

• The valve body defines a bore with first and second inlet passages for receiving fluids at predetermined pressures, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture.

• A flow restricting device is used to reduce the flow rate of fluid from the first inlet passage to the outlet passage.

• The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water, and can operate multiple identical systems from common sources without affecting fluid pressure.

* The invention relates to a method for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, and an arrangement for carrying out the method. The method includes compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to a lower pressure to achieve the desired exit temperature and pressure.
* The compressor station includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, and valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and heat exchanger to the gas pipeline. An electronic control operates the compressor and valves to compress the gas to an excess pressure and expand it to the desired exit pressure.
* The invention utilizes the physical effect that compressed gas cools when expanded to a lower pressure. The gas is compressed to an excess pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure, which is sufficient for cooling the gas to the required temperature for re-entry into the gas pipeline.
* The compressor station can be configured with multiple stages of compression, including two primary compression stages with compressors having approximately the same pressure ratio for exchanging compressors. This allows for efficient operation during both warm and cold seasons, reducing the need for special re-cooling units and lowering investment costs by approximately 40-45% compared to conventional re-cooling technology.

* The text discusses a system for eliminating traditional fasteners used in securing cooling fans to enclosures, applicable in various industries including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation.
* It describes a cooling fan assembly that can be used in any application requiring forced air cooling for adequate heat dissipation.
* The assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor control components, with the motor often featuring a non-rotatable housing and motor carrier with mounting legs.
* Each mounting leg has resilient leg portions separated by a compression gap, designed to fit into recessed portions on the panel.
* The motor carrier includes spring members that urge the assembly away from the panel, preventing disengagement during normal operation.
* The installation process involves loading the assembly onto the panel, compressing the springs, rotating the assembly to align the mounting legs, and securing them within the recessed portions.
* The system ensures a secure and vibration-resistant connection between the cooling fan assembly and the panel, eliminating the need for traditional fasteners.

* The invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from flight loads, ensuring stability and minimizing damage.
* The mounts incorporate vibration damping materials into their designs, targeting the six suspension modes to dissipate energy into heat, thereby reducing disturbances to the instrument.
* The damping mechanism is strategically placed at flexural hinge locations, utilizing spherical dampers or cylindrical slot dampers composed of viscoelastic materials, which exhibit frequency-dependent properties suitable for flight and on-orbit conditions.
* The proposed mounting scheme simplifies manufacturing complexity and costs, uncouples suspension vibration modes for improved performance in dynamic applications, and is applicable to a wide range of precision and optical instruments.

* The invention relates to a novel and improved clutch unit designed for large size power transmission requirements, specifically addressing issues of force application, cooling, and minimizing residual drag.
* The clutch unit comprises interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, allowing for strong coupling forces while maintaining high control accuracy. Auxiliary fluid pressure control means retract the plates to reduce residual drag and act as a coolant for the discs.
* The clutch discs are segmented, facilitating easy replacement of individual segments without complete disassembly of the unit. This is achieved through a design that allows for the removal and replacement of clutch disc segments by rotating and sliding out the segments, then reinserting them after replacement.
* The system utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes: simultaneously applying pressurized fluid to couple the plates and discs, and retracting the plates to reduce residual drag and cool the clutch discs through the centrifugal force of the oil. This design minimizes residual drag, which is crucial for high-capacity clutch units.

• The invention relates to an internal combustion engine that incorporates combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders to lower the temperature of exhaust gases and fluids, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator. 

• Key features include downstream expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to provide sufficient surface area and displacement for energy recapture, a catalytic material placed on surfaces to convert impurities in exhaust gases, water recovery from a system with water injection and combustion cylinders, and gearing between cylinders to optimize output and drive the crankshaft in a non-one-to-one fashion.

• The engine design aims to maximize the capture of useful energy, reduce heat loss, and potentially eliminate the radiator, with improvements over prior systems in terms of efficiency, heat management, and exhaust gas treatment.

• The invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat, which includes an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer. An area at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed.

• The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum. The metal alloy layer of the precoat typically comprises, by weight, from 8 to 11% of silicon, from 2 to 4% of iron, the remainder of the compound being aluminum and inevitable impurities.

• The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm. The area can vary in width.

• The present invention also provides a method that includes the steps of coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat including an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and then removing the metal alloy layer in an area at the periphery of the plate.

• The invention further provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate that includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, on at least one face of the plate, removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate, and cutting the plate in a plane so that the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is at the periphery of the cut plate.

* The present invention is a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers energy from severe weather patterns.
* The system includes an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction by accounting for data from weather observations, sensors on the mobile structure, and performance models for the structure itself.
* It is exemplified in an offshore energy recovery system where the algorithm navigates a sailing vessel to reduce drag and respond to wind and water velocity vectors by adjusting sail points, rudder rotation, turbine gate openness, and ballast draft.
* The SCADA system gathers data through various means such as GPS, weather satellites, and other geographic and weather data resources.
* It includes computer servers running secure software applications that communicate with microprocessor systems on the mobile structure for remote human interaction and navigation plans.
* The system is not limited to the referenced Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system and applies to any mobile structure that exploits energy from weather patterns.
* It enables automatic operation of the mobile structure to navigate through hazardous environments, making manned operation undesirable.
* The system uses an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction, and without it, the mobile structure may navigate past weather patterns for logistics purposes.
* The system includes a graphical user interface on client computers for remote humans to interact with and control the mobile structure.

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced through forming production steps from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction.
* The cage is designed to guide rolling bodies and is produced from a sheet metal material with axial profiling and rolling body guide structures.
* DE 1 625 540 A1 discloses a ball bearing cage with two axially profiled ring elements that form spherical cap pockets connected via bridge portions.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs by minimizing cutting waste during manufacturing.
* The rolling body guide cage is produced from at least two flat material ring segments joined and welded in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are connected across engagement zones with positively engaging joint contours forming an undercut geometry.
* The segments are cut out from a sheet metal material, with 120° segments allowing for three weld joints per ring element.
* The method involves joining flat material ring segments before forming the axial profiling.
* Welding can be performed using laser welding or pressure welding, with local accumulations of material aiding in weld seam formation.
* The ring segments can be initially oversized, further cut, and calibrated after welding, or cut to final dimensions before forming.
* The process allows for efficient joining of ring segments during the workpiece movement of the punching process or by aligning edges to form a stack or ring segment block.
* A material bead close to the edge is generated during punching, providing a material volume for complete weld seam filling, avoiding chamfer formation.

* The text describes methods and systems for obtaining, processing, and transmitting information related to providing customer service at a customer service location. This includes acquiring information such as latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the customer service location and using these coordinates to find the location and provide directions for service technicians.
* The systems involve a technician input device for receiving and transmitting information, a technician server for processing the data, and various systems like a GPS for tracking locations, a dispatch system for managing service requests, an address guide system for storing addresses, and a customer record system for storing customer information. The methods and systems aim to enhance customer service response time by providing accurate location information and efficient routing for service technicians.

* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, focusing on magnetic field compensation with two sensors and a digital processor.
* It addresses the need for homogeneous or inhomogeneous field compensation based on the interference field characteristics.
* The system uses two real triaxial magnetic field sensors to measure the interfering field.
* The six output signals from the sensors are combined to create three output signals of a virtual sensor through averaging.
* The virtual sensor output signals are used as inputs for independent control loops that transform them into modified signals.
* These modified signals are then used to calculate control signals for the six coils generating the compensation field.
* The control system can handle broadband, selective frequency range, or selective frequency control algorithms.
* The system is adaptable for inhomogeneous interference by using a single actuator coil instead of a pair of Helmholtz coils.
* It avoids interferences between two compensation systems placed directly beside each other by accounting for feedback effects in the control structure.
* The control unit calculates the control signals by incorporating the feedback matrix, adjusting the signals to compensate for interference effectively.
* The system's algorithm allows for compensation of both homogeneous and inhomogeneous fields, enhancing its versatility and effectiveness in various applications.

* The invention provides an improved method for CARS microscopy by furnishing at least one resonance site in a sample derived from a biological source through a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner. This allows for selective accentuation of defined structures in the sample and increases specificity and scattering cross section when necessary.
* The method utilizes bioorthogonal reactions, which are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes, to introduce resonance sites into the sample. This enables dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, such as cells, without affecting biochemical processes, and allows for the synthesis or introduction of "active" substances for CARS image production, enhancing sensitivity and specificity in CARS microscopy.

* The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, comparing them, and determining their quality.
* It uses an electronic computer to receive and process different three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing a structure in a human patient intended for radiation therapy.
* The system generates volume models from the received electronic files and compares them to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* A metric method measures the conformance between the three-dimensional surfaces, considering the number of missing and extra volume elements.
* The system can display the results in a user-friendly format, highlighting regions of error.
* It supports customizable metric methods, allowing for tailored evaluation criteria.
* The system can compare segmentations from different sources, including manual segmentations, automatic segmentations, and different software systems.
* It can be used for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes, including quality assurance of autosegmentation routines.
* The system can assess the impact of errors in segmentation on clinical outcomes, considering their distance from the desired segmentation surface.
* It can provide quantitative and qualitative outputs, including histograms and tables, to evaluate the quality of segmentations.

* The text discusses an invention related to data processing systems, specifically for executing floating point operations more efficiently.
* It introduces two related U.S. Patent applications for apparatus and methods to accelerate floating point operations.
* The background explains the complexity and time-consuming nature of floating point addition and subtraction due to the need for aligning fractions and potentially normalizing the result.
* The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation by determining a difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals before calculating the complete difference.
* This technique allows initiating the subtraction procedure early, reducing the overall time required for the effective subtraction operation.
* The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference between exponent arguments, optimizing the process for both scenarios.
* The apparatus implementing the invention includes units for determining the difference between operand exponent arguments, a subset of operand exponent arguments, and for selecting the correct final fraction result based on these differences.

• The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples in medical facilities.

• It eliminates the cost of vial labels, associated printers, and staff labor dealing with vial labels by pre-printing vial barcodes.

• The system utilizes one or more standalone or networked computers connected to local or remote computer storage via wired, wireless, or combined networks.

• The method involves storing unique machine-readable codes for patient ID, order, specimen-taker ID, and specimen containers in a relational manner.

• Each code is unique, with the patient barcode encoding personal information, the vial barcode specifying container details, and the order barcode detailing the specimen acquisition.

• An optical barcode scanner reads and dispatches these codes to a processor, which verifies patient and order codes match before proceeding.

• The system ensures accurate specimen collection and processing, reducing mislabeling errors and improving patient safety.

• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device designed for golfers, incorporating GPS technology and voice recognition for providing distance and other relevant information in a verbal format.

• The device can be integrated into various portable devices, such as hats or visors, and uses commercially available GPS data for distance measurement and conversion.

• It features voice recognition technology for accepting commands and voice synthesis for audible output, enhancing user interaction and convenience.

• The device can predict golf strategy, club selection, and other needs based on user input and historical data, using an expert system to learn and generate recommendations.

• The unique design allows direct contact of the bone conductance vibration sensor with the user's forehead, improving voice recognition accuracy and providing a unique advantage.

• The device can be expanded with additional features, such as Bluetooth for data transfers, audio server/client capabilities, short-range audio communications, and remote GPS functionality.

* The invention provides a system and method for accurately reporting appropriate errors for logic and memory regions in a system-on-chip integrated circuit design.
* It eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions not subject to the same design rules.
* The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data by customizing logic rules for different types of memory regions.
* Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of specific regions, pushing more liberal memory parameters onto stricter logic parameters.
* The system checks logic and memory regions with appropriate rules, categorizing results into separate error reports for logic, memory types, and other circuit types.
* The invention ensures all memory regions fulfill memory rules and logic regions fulfill both logic and memory rules, improving accuracy and efficiency over prior art techniques.
* It divides layers of mask pattern data into logic, memory, and other regions, applying the correct sets of rules to each, eliminating false errors and expediting circuit design implementation.

• The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators (SLMs).

• Thin substrate waveguides, characterized by a thickness much greater than the wavelength (t>>λ), are used to avoid difficulties in coupling the optical source and allow for convenient white light illumination.

• These waveguides can be particularly used for situations requiring controlled illumination, compensating for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront through exposure to a photographic emulsion or by recording the hologram non-uniformly.

• The illumination system comprises a light source optically coupled to a waveguide with a hologram, replacing complex systems with compact, rugged arrangements that maintain mutual alignment and reduce reflection losses.

• Compared to conventional lens systems, waveguide hologram illuminators occupy much less space, offering a gain in active volume that can be several orders of magnitude higher.

• High diffraction efficiencies, typically in the range of 0.6 to 0.99, are achievable with waveguide holograms, making them ideal for minimizing stray light and providing coherent illumination without the need for additional optical elements.

* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors. The apparatus includes a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, exciting means for magnetizing the rotor, voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal, current sensing means for generating a current signal, and processing means for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor.
* The test apparatus also includes skew sensing means for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor, which allows the processing means to determine the effective electrical skew of the rotor. This provides a novel, economical, and reliable method for non-destructive measurement of the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of dynamoelectric machine rotors.
* The test apparatus is designed to provide automatic pass/fail determinations, detailed statistical comparison and evaluation of measurement results, and identification of defective rotors. It utilizes a dual test fixture embodiment with two test fixtures, each comprising a test head and a hydraulically driven retraction and drive mechanism, mounted in a test stand for convenient operator access.
* The test head structure is unique, utilizing a core of magnetic material similar to a conventional dynamoelectric machine stator, with primary windings for exciting the rotor, voltage sensing pick-up coils for generating a voltage signal, skew sensing pick-up coils for generating an effective skew signal, and a current sensor for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor. The data acquisition, processing, and control system includes a data processor and a control processor, with the system controlling the testing sequence, data acquisition, and processing without further operator intervention.

* The text describes a method for securing a computing device, particularly a mobile device, by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library based on a digital certificate associated with the library, while denying access to the same resources for a managed application unless authorized through a similar certificate.
* It outlines an operational procedure for securing a computing device, including granting access to native resources to a managed library upon validating its digital certificate, and denying access to native resources for a managed application unless it includes a certificate authorizing specific resource access through a managed library.
* The text also discusses alternative embodiments, such as managed libraries being developed by trusted developers, verifying digital signatures for containers and runtime hosts, and managing access to premium native system resources through premium certificates.
* It further explains operational procedures related to receiving packages from networked computer systems, identifying executables, verifying managed metadata to ensure type-safe code, and storing verified executables in digitally signed containers.
* The text provides a detailed description of the operational procedures and technical aspects involved in securing mobile devices, including validation of digital certificates, verification of managed metadata, and management of access to native resources through managed libraries and applications.

* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, allowing for printing of artwork, and then enclosed between two rigid outer layers for added protection and durability.
* The card utilizes a core layer made of a silica-filled polyolefin, which is pre-shrunk to prevent shrinking during the manufacturing process. An alkyd resin spid is printed on the core layer, followed by the attachment of an antenna and integrated circuit chip.
* The card is manufactured using a lamination process that involves bonding the core layer with the integrated circuit chip and antenna to a bottom sheet, then sandwiching this assembly between two rigid outer layers. This design protects the electronic components from damage and enhances the card's durability and ease of manufacture compared to previous smart card designs.

* The invention relates to implementing a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue, in a memory, especially in functional memories.
* In functional memories, updates are made by copying the path from the root to the update point before performing the update.
* A typical FIFO queue implementation uses a double-ended list, which is inefficient in functional memory environments due to extensive copying.
* The invention proposes implementing a queue using a tree-shaped structure with nodes of a given maximum size.
* Additions are directed to the first non-full node seen from below on the first edge of the data structure, and deletions are directed to a leaf node on the opposite edge.
* Leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level to minimize copying during updates.
* Updates require time and space logarithmically dependent on the queue's length, reducing the amount of required copying.
* A preferred embodiment includes a header node with three elements: one for the end, one for the tree structure, and one for the beginning.
* The header node facilitates faster updates and less memory space usage compared to previous methods.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and space, making it suitable for double-ended queue operations.
* A block diagram illustrates a memory arrangement implementing the invention with a header node, control logic, and intermediate registers.
* The invention is adaptable, allowing for modifications such as variable node sizes and separate storage for actual records.

* The invention aims to provide practical methods for building embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacturing technologies, focusing on EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits and EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies without requiring high voltages.
* The EPROM devices utilize existing circuit elements, such as DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, and leverage transistor properties under stress conditions to support EPROM operations, offering advantages in manufacturing cost, reliability, and application flexibility.

• The invention relates to a technique for easily and quickly determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control.

• Feedback control is frequently adopted for moving an automatic guidance vehicle along a predetermined course, involving steps of detecting error, calculating correction amount, and correcting steering angle.

• The correction amount is calculated using P, PI, PD, or PID systems, where P, I, and D are proportional, integral, and differential gains, respectively. These gains significantly influence feedback control characteristics.

• The limit sensitivity process, a traditional method, determines the optimum value of feedback gain by finding the P gain with self-sustaining vibration error and setting I and D gains based on the P gain and vibration period.

• The invention provides a method to determine feedback gain easily and accurately, irrespective of the subject of control, by executing feedback control, detecting error, calculating an evaluation value, and determining a feedback gain value based on the relation between feedback gain value and evaluation value.

• For determining the proportional gain, the ratio between the length of the error curve plotted against time and the time axis is calculated as the evaluation value.

• For determining the integral gain, the evaluation value is calculated by integrating the error, and for determining the differential gain, the evaluation value is calculated by integrating the absolute value of the error.

• The invention is applied to the running control of an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV), where the method is used to determine the optimum values of the proportional, integral, and differential gains for controlling the vehicle's speed and steering angle.

• The first embodiment applies the method to the AGV's running control, determining the gains for each section of the running course separately, while the second embodiment determines the gains continuously as the AGV runs along the entire course.

• The invention is not limited to the P, I, and D gains and can be applied to other feedback gains. The order of determining the gains can vary, and other suitable evaluation functions can be used.

• The invention relates to a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end, designed to reduce the size of the entire lens system while maintaining high optical performance throughout the zooming range.

• The zoom lens comprises specific lens units arranged in a particular configuration, with conditions (1)-(4) satisfied for the construction and arrangement of the fourth and fifth lens units. These conditions ensure good correction of aberrations for high-grade optical performance.

• The technical significance of conditions (1)-(4) is explained, focusing on refractive power, refractive power ratio, and Abbe numbers to correct various aberrations effectively.

• The zoom lens achieves a reduction in physical length while minimizing the variation of aberrations with zooming, with the total length L reduced to as short as 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.

* The invention provides a method and device for detecting elementary particles, reducing drawbacks of prior art methods and devices.
* The method involves discharging a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, enabling detection of individual particles and integration of signals.
* Signals are separated as a function of their rate by a capacitor preceding the first amplifier or an inductive element preceding the second amplifier.
* Amplifications in the different amplifiers are performed at overlapping rates of signals for calibration and detection.
* The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
* A material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, like diamond, is used for precise and reliable detection.
* The device includes a support capacitor for compensating discharging of the detector, maintaining functionality at high radiation or ionization rates.
* The method and device are applicable in various fields, including particle accelerators, reactors, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering.
* The invention enables reliable detection of small-size signals without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.

• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.

• The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring, a movable ring, and a torque motor.

• The torque motor has an output shaft connected to a splined hub, onto which the driven disc assembly is mounted.

• The movable ring is moved towards the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.

• The distance between the two rings is measured when engaged.

• The torque motor is energized to apply a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly.

• The movable ring is then gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce frictional force.

• The driven disc assembly begins to rotate when torque exceeds frictional force.

• The difference between the initial and final ring distances is compared to a standard value to determine warpage.

• The apparatus automatically determines if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances and generates external indications to the operator.

• The text describes methods and software for estimating the age of a person represented in first image data, using a contourlet transform and classifying the subject face according to aging mechanisms.

• The system can be implemented by a computing device programmed with instructions for performing the age-estimation method, capable of receiving and storing necessary data, and providing a user interface for setting up sessions and viewing results.

• The first image data typically represents a digital or digitized photograph of one or more persons' faces for which ages are desired to be estimated.

• A database of second image data comprises faces with assigned landmark points, which can be used for training the system.

• The CAM algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from the face images, modeling both shape and texture variations.

• A statistical PCA model is built for the contourlet-level appearance, combining shape and texture parameters.

• Support Vector Regression is used to construct aging functions for different age groups, while Support Vector Machines are used to build an age classifier.

• The system classifies the subject face as young or old before applying the appropriate aging function to estimate the age.

• Estimated ages can be provided as a single value or a set of values with confidence factors, and results can be stored, transmitted, or used in various applications.

• A computing system is described that can implement the age-estimation methods, including a processor, memory, storage device, input/output devices, and network interface for data processing and communication.

• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, particularly useful in applications requiring the simultaneous display of images with different definitions or natures.

• The device comprises a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, each dedicated to display either the first or second image, or a combination of both, depending on their respective definitions.

• Each arrangement can be a square of four pixels, with three dedicated to the first image and one to the second, or vice versa, facilitating the display of images with different color palettes.

• The controller of the device can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image, reducing their intensity when the second image's signals exceed a threshold, to preserve the first image's definition.

• The remaining pixels of the display device can be configured to display two colors that, when combined, restore the color of the first image, enhancing the merging process.

• The device can include dedicated hardware architectures, such as two controllers interfacing with the first and second images, respectively, optimizing consumption and allowing for different definitions and refresh frequencies.

• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system, with a housing containing electronics and a communication means that can interact with a security system on board the vehicle.

• The transmitter includes a payment element that can be removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing. This allows the user to perform various payment actions, such as at a gas station or shopping center, while the transmitter is in use.

• In the secure state, the payment element is removed from the receptacle, and a closure protects and seals the receptacle. This prevents unauthorized payment actions while preserving the keyless activation of the vehicle's security system.

• The payment element can have a microprocessor and communicate with a payment system, executing remote financial transactions like loading or debiting amounts. It can also have a storage device for codes, balances, or secret values.

• The closure can be designed as a dummy plug or a cable-mounted plug, ensuring a reliable hold in the receptacle and preventing the closure from being lost. The payment element can be integrated into a carrier that fits into the receptacle, providing an additional layer of security.

• The text discusses an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use, often entering a "sleep mode" to save energy.

• When the device wakes up, it starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner, which can lead to inconsistent image quality if the toner's tribo charge decreases over a long period of inactivity.

• The disclosed embodiments address this issue by determining periods of inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on these periods.

• One method involves measuring the toner charge level when the device is recovered from inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between the measured charge and the predetermined level.

• Another method includes an inactivity determining section that calculates the idle time and determines the user pattern, predicting the next user usage, and storing this information for future use.

• The charging section then instructs the machine to charge the toner to a predetermined level suitable for performing a printing operation, ensuring the developer is at an adequate charge level for normal printing.
